metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Jannath, where the player can learn more about what happened to Oskar after he left the Zhent camp, how they got married and suddenly he started acting weird. She will ask help from players to stop the possession and will point players towards the atelier for clues.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Interact with Jannath in the Artist House bedroom.Location CTY_Main:A -253; 29; -46

17.speaker: Lady Jannath
17.text: If you don't wish to help, leave.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: I'll look into it. Any idea where I should start?

225.speaker: Player
225.text: I'm not one of your servants. You can't order me around.

249.speaker: Lady Jannath
249.text: I can assure you, you wouldn't get a job on my staff. Now if you've nothing to contribute - leave.
249.context: NodeContext: Scornful, unimpressed you won't help Oskar

18.speaker: Lady Jannath
18.text: Now, not that I'm ungrateful for your help, but -
18.context: NodeContext: Relieved, trying to hurry you out of the house until she realises -

106.speaker: Lady Jannath
106.text: Wait - your face is familiar to me. Yes, I've seen it before, in Oskar's sketches. You're the one who saved him from the Zhentarim.
106.context: NodeContext: Recognising you, can't wuite beleive it's true

45.speaker: Player
45.text: What in the hells is going on here?

9.speaker: Lady Jannath
9.text: I imagine this must be quite a shock. Hardly the Oskar you remember.

245.speaker: Player
245.text: I came to congratulate you on your wedding, but, erm...

171.speaker: Lady Jannath
171.text: Yes, it's all gone rather tits up, hasn't it? To think that happiness was just a few days ago...

172.speaker: Player
172.text: And you must be his patron?

169.speaker: Lady Jannath
169.text: I used to be. Now I'm his wife - we married not a tenday ago. Things have changed rather a lot since then...

68.speaker: Lady Jannath
68.text: Had I known this would happen, I... oh, who am I kidding? I'd still have married him.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: He's a charming git, I'll give him that.

63.speaker: Lady Jannath
63.text: That's Oskar. I've known many artists, and none have half his talent, or his charisma. He had our guests eating from the palm of his hands.
63.context: NodeContext: A sad smile - warmed by the memory of him, but sad at what he's become

66.speaker: Lady Jannath
66.text: Yes, I suppose I love him entirely.

233.speaker: Lady Jannath
233.text: This isn't the real him - you know it as well as I.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I hope he drew my most heroic side.

34.speaker: Lady Jannath
34.text: Both sides of you look the same to me. But he worked hard to capture your likeness. Sketched you over and over until he was satisfied.

59.speaker: Lady Jannath
59.text: You made quite an impression. His 'valiant protector'. A shame you didn't get here sooner. You might have saved him again.
59.context: NodeContext: 'Valiant protector' said with a hint of a smile, recalling Oskar's passionate stories of the player. Then a hint of black humour at the thought you could have saved him (didn't really expect you to)

16.speaker: Player
16.text: What exactly is wrong with him?

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Why would I do that? I'm not his bloody wet nurse.

22.speaker: Lady Jannath
22.text: Don't take that tone with me. I know he's not your responsibility. He's mine. And I'm failing him.
22.context: NodeContext: First half up to 'responsibility' is sharp - she's a noble, not one who tolerates being disrespected. Second half with a sigh - she's frustrated, angry at herself

195.speaker: Lady Jannath
195.text: You should have seen him on our wedding day. So vibrant. So alive. He couldn't have been happier.
195.context: NodeContext: Hiding her heartbreak, trying to sound matter of fact

209.speaker: Player
209.text: You're his wife. Isn't that your responsibility now?

248.speaker: Lady Jannath
248.text: You think I haven't tended to him? Mopped his brow? Cleaned his messes? But whatever this is - it is beyond my ability to cure.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I'm not here to save anyone. I just want the gold Oskar owes me.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: 'Impoverished purchaser', more like. I'm here to collect the gold he owes me.

48.speaker: Lady Jannath
48.text: As you can see, Oskar is in no condition to pay anyone anything.

148.speaker: Lady Jannath
148.text: Not long after the wedding, he lost his appetite, fell into dark moods. He started to avoid my company entirely.
148.context: NodeContext: Trying not to sound hurt/take this personally

184.speaker: Lady Jannath
184.text: Artistic temperament, I thought. But it worsened. He became violent. Called me some rather imaginative names.
184.context: NodeContext: 'imaginative names' implying vile swear words

28.speaker: Lady Jannath
28.text: I hesitate to say it... but I think you're right. Something supernatural has taken hold of him. Oskar has been possessed.

93.speaker: Lady Jannath
93.text: I hesitate to say it... Something unnatural has taken hold of him. Oskar has been possessed.
93.context: NodeContext: 'unnatural' implying supernatural. As a practical woman, she can hardly believe she's saying this

176.speaker: Lady Jannath
176.text: The last time I left this room, the walls started bleeding, and a portrait of my mother tried to bite me.

64.speaker: Lady Jannath
64.text: Flying furniture and screaming portraits I could deal with, but to see my husband reduced to such a state...

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I had no idea he'd married. Then I take it you were his patron?

46.speaker: Lady Jannath
46.text: I can't come within arm's reach without him trying to strangle me. And he calls me such vile things. It hates everyone, but it loathes me.

159.speaker: Lady Jannath
159.text: It's not him. I know he would never hurt me. And I promised I would let no harm come to him...
159.context: NodeContext: almost to self, not sure if she believes it any more

109.speaker: Lady Jannath
109.text: As you can see, I've already failed. It's obvious he needs more help than I can give.
109.context: NodeContext: Disappointed in herself, tried to protect him but

61.speaker: Lady Jannath
61.text: Please - you saved him once. You must find a way to cure him.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: While I've been... aided by powerful forces, that doesn't mean I can help Oskar. He needs an expert.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Possessions cannot be fixed with a simple 'cure'. He needs an expert in the supernatural.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Trust me. He's not worth the trouble.

214.speaker: Lady Jannath
214.text: He's my husband. He's worth everything.

147.speaker: Lady Jannath
147.text: I'm surprised you're so callous. This is hardly the picture Oskar painted of you.
147.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - she'd heard you were Oskar's guardian angel

135.speaker: Player
135.text: He's a flatterer and a liar. He loved another when he married you.

136.speaker: Lady Jannath
136.text: Hardly a revelation. Who doesn't have old flames to douse before they settle down? The matter was resolved, and our marriage began an honest one.

103.speaker: Lady Jannath
103.text: If that's your only objection, then disregard it, and help him. He needs you.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: While I've been... aided by powerful forces, that doesn't mean I can help Oskar. He needs an expert.

104.speaker: Lady Jannath
104.text: I can't tell anyone about this. It was hard enough to keep it from the servants.

70.speaker: Lady Jannath
70.text: The city is rife with paranoia. If word got out about his condition... well, the Steel Watch are hardly known for showing mercy.

185.speaker: Lady Jannath
185.text: I need someone to look into this quietly. It's the only chance he has.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Possessions cannot be fixed with a simple 'cure'. He needs an expert in the supernatural.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: He needs a doctor, not an adventurer.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: He's too dangerous. A merciful death is the best I can offer.

91.speaker: Lady Jannath
91.text: I hardly think we need to consider something that drastic.
91.context: NodeContext: Firm on the first statement - she won't entertain the idea

243.speaker: Lady Jannath
243.text: I will tend to him as I have been. Perhaps he will regain his sense of his own accord, once this spirit tires of tormenting us.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Fine, I'll do it. But I need his debt settled, and more.

74.speaker: Lady Jannath
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jannath raises an eyebrowNodeContext: Almost amused by you, just an observation

133.speaker: Lady Jannath
133.text: Gold is no object, when it comes to my husband's life. But first, you must cure him.
133.context: NodeContext: Stifling her annoyance that you're bringing up money at a time like this

221.speaker: Lady Jannath
221.text: Oskar's behaviour began to change shortly after the wedding. He became withdrawn, working obsessively up in his atelier.

207.speaker: Lady Jannath
207.text: I tried to take him some food, but I couldn't cross the threshold. It was as though the house itself didn't want me up there.

11.speaker: Lady Jannath
11.text: Whatever this thing is, it doesn't want anyone going up there. I swear it's in the walls, watching.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: This time, Oskar's on his own.

4.speaker: Lady Jannath
4.text: You might be ready to abandon Oskar, but I'm not.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I suppose I'd best live up to my reputation, then. Where should I start?

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Face of an angel, soul of a cad, I'm afraid.

54.speaker: Lady Jannath
54.text: I see. Then I think you should go.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: What married couple hasn't wanted to kill each other at some point?

231.speaker: Lady Jannath
231.text: This is no time for trite witticisms - this is serious.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: It doesn't seem personal - he tried to kill me too.

239.speaker: Lady Jannath
239.text: It's true, he lashes out at everyone. I had to send my staff away for their safety.
239.context: NodeContext: Not being patronising, simply stating the truth

156.speaker: Player
156.text: You're sure he hasn't been, you know, sniffing his paints...?

181.speaker: Lady Jannath
181.text: He almost broke my arm this morning when I tried to feed him soup.
181.context: NodeContext: Giving an example of something horrifically violent Oskar has done

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm not generally fond of my face being known.

86.speaker: Lady Jannath
86.text: He made a point to keep it in his private collection. Was quite adamant about it, in fact.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: It's no easy task facing up against a loved one. Well done.

236.speaker: Lady Jannath
236.text: I've had plenty of practice, unfortunately.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: I know the signs of the supernatural when I see them. Tell me everything about Oskar's condition.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I know supernatural influence when I see it. Tell me everything about Oskar's condition.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: You're remarkably calm, given your husband just tried to kill us.

199.speaker: Lady Jannath
199.text: I'm getting rather used to it, unfortunately.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: I did. And I've come to collect the reward he promised.

76.speaker: Lady Jannath
76.text: Oskar's saviour once more. I can't tell you how grateful I am to you.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: You're most welcome. Anything to support the arts.

201.speaker: Lady Jannath
201.text: Yes, rather more exciting than a fund-raising banquet, wasn't it?
201.context: NodeContext: Wry smile, allowing herself to relax slightly

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You're sure you want to stay with Oskar, after all this?

51.speaker: Lady Jannath
51.text: I'm afraid when one falls in love with an artist, such drama comes with the territory.

196.speaker: Lady Jannath
196.text: Needless to say, Oskar won't be having anything more to do with the supernatural. One possession is quite enough for any marriage.

19.speaker: Lady Jannath
19.text: You must take up his offer - go to his atelier, sit for him. Then perhaps you will understand what I see in him, flawed as he is.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: You can show me. With gold. Lots of gold.

166.speaker: Lady Jannath
166.text: I wouldn't dream of rewarding such bravery with gold. Besides, this is Oskar's debt to settle.

71.speaker: Lady Jannath
71.text: The painting he offers is worth far more - one day, it may be priceless. He will go on to great things, thanks to you.

73.speaker: Lady Jannath
73.text: Please - go to his atelier. Sit for him. You won't be disappointed.

96.speaker: Lady Jannath
96.text: A new face. How wonderful. Always good to see fresh interest in the arts.

97.speaker: Lady Jannath
97.text: Please - enjoy the day. Just don't touch anything.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: May I ask who you are?

100.speaker: Lady Jannath
100.text: I am Lady Fireliia Jannath, mistress of the house and patron of the arts.

40.speaker: Lady Jannath
40.text: I'm glad to welcome art lovers of all kinds beneath my roof, so please - feel free to enjoy my galleries.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Could I buy something from your private collection?

65.speaker: Lady Jannath
65.text: Ah, you're a fellow collector. I see no harm in that - I've a few pieces gathering dust.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: How much, off the top of your head, would you say some of your paintings are worth?

244.speaker: Lady Jannath
244.text: Many were painted by someone I held dear to my heart. And, as such, they are like him - priceless. I have some other pieces I'd be willing to part with, if you'd like to take a look?
244.context: NodeContext: a small smile as she thinks of oskar

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I think I met your fiancé, Oskar.

56.speaker: Lady Jannath
56.text: You did? Well, finish the thought. Where is he? What happened to him?
56.context: NodeContext: Brisk, used to getting what she asks for

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Oh, I really haven't the foggiest. I lost him some time ago.

187.speaker: Lady Jannath
187.text: Then we are both adrift on the same tide. Perhaps one day we will learn what became of him.

170.speaker: Lady Jannath
170.text: Still, there's no balm for a wounded soul like a moment reflecting on a good painting. Please - enjoy your visit.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: He was enslaved by the Zhentarim. I saw him die.

164.speaker: Lady Jannath
164.text: Why would those thugs take my poor, sweet Oskar? Did they want money? I never received a ransom note...

222.speaker: Lady Jannath
222.text: I knew he didn't leave willingly. Oh, my gentle painter... snuffed out like a candle.
222.context: NodeContext: Deeply upset, maintaining a stiff upper lip

21.speaker: Player
21.text: He died a horrible death, screaming in agony.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: He was captured and enslaved by the Zhentarim.

113.speaker: Lady Jannath
113.text: And you just left him there? Anything could have happened by now!

130.speaker: Lady Jannath
130.text: Oh, my poor Oskar, how ever will I bring you home?

190.speaker: Lady Jannath
190.context: NodeContext: Deeply upset, maintaining a polite 'stiff upper lip'

162.speaker: Player
162.text: He was working for the Zhentarim. It got him killed.

38.speaker: Lady Jannath
38.text: What did he get himself tangled up in? Silly, silly boy.
38.context: NodeContext: Shocked, angry but trying not to let it show

10.speaker: Lady Jannath
10.text: Perhaps I'm equally foolish, to have believed he cared for me, and not the contents of my coffers.

35.speaker: Lady Jannath
35.text: At least you've done me the favour of not having to worry about him any further. Take this - get it out of my sight.

238.speaker: Lady Jannath
238.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I have guests to attend to.

85.speaker: Lady Jannath
85.text: Ah. I see I've managed to lose my engagement ring already. Saves me the bother of tossing it away.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: He's in the Guildhall, working with the Zhentarim.

95.speaker: Lady Jannath
95.text: Is this some kind of joke? Oskar's in the city, and he's a criminal?

144.speaker: Lady Jannath
144.text: Oh, that stupid boy. If that's the reason he called off our engagement, then good bloody riddance to him.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: He ran away from your wedding because he was in love with someone else.

15.speaker: Lady Jannath
15.text: I should have known. Gods, what a fool he took me for all those years.

102.speaker: Lady Jannath
102.text: I'm sorry. I think I need a moment.
102.context: NodeContext: Stunned and saddened by what she's been told, but maintaining a stiff upper lip

127.speaker: Lady Jannath
127.text: So. First you save my husband, then you save our marriage. I can't tell you how grateful I am.

189.speaker: Lady Jannath
189.context: NodeContext: Curt. In a bad mood - broken up with husband

226.speaker: Player
226.text: What will you do once Oskar is gone?

92.speaker: Lady Jannath
92.text: The same thing I did before he arrived: enjoy my bloody life. Go to galleries. Drink fine wine. Enjoy a home not ravaged by a psychotic ghost.

125.speaker: Lady Jannath
125.text: I'm done with him, and this whole sorry business. Now please - I have a house to get back in order.
125.context: NodeContext: angry, but not at the player. Wants to get on with things.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Watch your tone. I'm not the one to blame for this.

47.speaker: Lady Jannath
47.text: I'll speak however I bloody like in my own house. If you don't like it, you're very welcome to leave with Oskar.

200.speaker: Lady Jannath
200.text: Did you find anything in Oskar's atelier?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: A letter from Mystic Carrion. Oskar had dealings with him.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: A letter from someone named 'Mystic Carrion'.

94.speaker: Lady Jannath
94.context: NodeContext: Someone she's familiar with, and despises

119.speaker: Lady Jannath
119.text: Carrion calls himself a 'spirit medium'. His morbid services are something of a fad among the nobility. From what I've heard, it's invitation only.
119.context: NodeContext: Finds everything about this ridiculous

101.speaker: Lady Jannath
101.text: He has a mansion, down near the water. A forsaken place, dank and decayed as he is.

218.speaker: Lady Jannath
218.text: You must find Mystic Carrion. If he's responsible for this mess, he can bloody well clean it up!

58.speaker: Player
58.text: There's a painting of his former lover, hidden in a side chamber.

152.speaker: Lady Jannath
152.text: Perhaps I asked too much, making him let her go so quickly.
152.context: NodeContext: Hiding how much this hurts her

27.speaker: Lady Jannath
27.text: His lovesickness will pass, with time. Did you find anything else?

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Plenty of paintings. The work of an amateur.

107.speaker: Lady Jannath
107.text: If I wanted to hear your artistic opinions, I'd ask for them.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Some valuable pieces. You should sell them.

20.speaker: Lady Jannath
20.text: Did you find anything that might help Oskar?
20.context: NodeContext: Forced to be more specific, irritated

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Some beautiful pieces of art. Oskar is truly talented.

60.speaker: Lady Jannath
60.text: Of course - my husband is a visionary. But did you find anything that might help him?
60.context: NodeContext: Forced to be more specific, irritated

197.speaker: Lady Jannath
197.text: Please don't give up. There has to be something.

212.speaker: Lady Jannath
212.text: Did you speak with Carrion? Has he provided a cure?

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Oh, I killed him. He won't be inflicting any more possessions on unwitting patrons.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: He will, so long as I do something for him first.

80.speaker: Lady Jannath
80.text: Gods only know what tricks that man will pull to serve himself. Still, if that's the only way to help Oskar, we have no choice.

105.speaker: Lady Jannath
105.text: Whatever he's asked, do it quickly. I don't know how much longer Oskar can bear this...

154.speaker: Player
154.text: He's demanding a lot of gold before he'll give it to me.

50.speaker: Lady Jannath
50.text: Poor Oskar. Held to ransom again...

242.speaker: Lady Jannath
242.text: Carrion bloody well knows I'll never give him a penny. Was there no other means of persuading him?

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Oskar's body is under immense strain. He won't survive without it.

213.speaker: Lady Jannath
213.text: Ugh, so be it. He's a foul creature to cause such misery and then expect payment to put it right.
213.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jannath hands over the gold to the player (unseen)

43.speaker: Lady Jannath
43.text: Carrion did this to him in the first place. How dare he expect payment to put it right?
43.context: NodeContext: A glimpse of true, passionate anger from her (directed at Carrion, not the player in front of her)

88.speaker: Lady Jannath
88.text: You must find some other way. Better yet, make Carrion pay for it.
88.context: NodeContext: Steely determination, implying she wouldn't mind you solving it violently

220.speaker: Player
220.text: I haggled him down to this price. It's his best offer.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: If you truly loved Oskar, this would be a trifling sum to save him.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You really care more of coin than another's life? Heartless.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: I have a Torch of Revocation. It should be enough to dispel the spirit.

178.speaker: Lady Jannath
178.text: Then what are you waiting for? Do it!

121.speaker: Lady Jannath
121.text: Go on, then. Why are you still here talking to me?

216.speaker: Lady Jannath
216.text: Oskar, my sweet love. What have you done to him?

230.speaker: Lady Jannath
230.text: I don't know what god sent you, but you have my thanks -
230.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken for her lover, appealing to the player

151.speaker: Lady Jannath
151.text: Wait - you're the one who saved Oskar from those bandits, aren't you? I've seen your face in his sketches.

36.speaker: Lady Jannath
36.text: Please - you must help him again. Oskar's been possessed.

173.speaker: Lady Jannath
173.text: There's no natural explanation for it. Some malevolent creature has taken hold of him, I'm sure of it.

1.speaker: Lady Jannath
1.text: You've given him some respite, but when he wakes, it will return. It always does.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: He needs a doctor, not an adventurer.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: He's too dangerous. A merciful death is the best I can offer.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Happy to help. Any idea where I should start?

217.speaker: Lady Jannath
217.text: Most of what he says is complete gibberish, of course, but when he does make any kind of sense, he mentions the atelier.

146.speaker: Lady Jannath
146.text: I've not been up there in days. The last time I tried, the walls started bleeding, and a portrait of my mother tried to bite me.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Fine, I'll do it. But I need his debt settled, and more.

227.speaker: Lady Jannath
227.text: Gold is no object, when it comes to my husband's life. But first, you must cure him.
227.context: NodeContext: Stifling her annoyance that you're bringing up money at a time like this

186.speaker: Player
186.text: This time, Oskar's on his own.

128.speaker: Lady Jannath
128.text: You might be ready to abandon Oskar, but I'm not.

234.speaker: Lady Jannath
234.text: I hope you're enjoying my little open house. Is there something I can do for you?

247.speaker: Lady Jannath
247.text: It broke him - not long after you left. There's nothing more to be done but grieve.
